intro: Helianthopsis lanata, commonly known as the woolly sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its hairy, woolly leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is known for its drought tolerance. Its unique appearance and adaptation to arid environments make it a notable species in its native habitat.
